author: yorickdowne
content: I see this as similar to an iOS or Windows release. Apps need to test on the new version. The part of the spec that impacts apps - the few changes to EVM such as what "difficulty" now does - has been stable. Tools to quickly spin up on Kiln exist.

author: yorickdowne
content: It's literally not possible for people who aren't part of that app team to do the testing. For reasons of scope, but also for reasons of unfamiliarity with that app's testing protocol - across thousands of apps.

author: mrfwashere
content: maybe my understanding is wrong, but I don't think the merge changes anything for things like opensea and their smart contracts? it just swaps out the consensus mechanism right? so why would there be concern over individual dapps and contracts?

author: yorickdowne
content: For two reasons. One, only the dApp developers know how they interact with difficulty, if it all, and with block times, if at all. Two, it is best practice to test, even when the message is "nothing changes"

author: yorickdowne
content: And yes. For the vast majority of dApps, they can sail through merge without testing and they'll be fine. Just that that's not best practice for large and valuable software projects.

author: mrfwashere
content:
just seems like a strange way to prioritize, if I was at opensea I would infinitely more concerned with the main parts of the merge succeeding and helping test that than some potential quirks with my own infra and new block times

some temporary outages (which they deal with all the time, or at least used to) versus the entire platform they operate on potentially falling over

author: yorickdowne
content:
It's more the dApp and block times. dApps should not rely on what the block time is. If they did anyway, that could potentially break things.
For difficulty, the opcode obviously can't return difficulty any more. It works still and returns the "output of the randomness beacon provided by  the beacon chain"

author: yorickdowne
content: See <https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-4399> . While this should be a transparent change to dApps, it's still good to test that. If dApps made assumptions about the nature of the value DIFFICULTY returns, those assumptions may break.
